title: 0 AD – After Dairy: A Split Bill Stand-Up Show
presenter: Liam Jackson and Grant Barr / Free Festival
description: An hour of wall-to-wall laughs from two of Scotland's most exciting new comedians – Liam Jackson and Grant Barr! Liam dissects his mishaps in the job market, travels and Scottish culture from a fresh perspective with verve and hilarity. ‘Very relaxed, confident, at ease on stage. Very consistent flow with good punchlines. Also... funny!’ (The Stand Comedy Club). Grant Barr is a stand-up and farmer hailing from the Kingdom of Fife. Grant's side-splitting observations and hysterical anecdotes on farming and rural Scottish life will leave you howling.; Category: Comedy

title: 0 Plans: A Crowd Work and Stand-up Comedy Show
description: A crowd-work and improvised stand-up comedy show with zero plans. Join us for an intimate night of comedy where Northern Irish comedian Reece Kidd and friends will entertain you and make you laugh. Reece has over 30 million views online and over 30,000 followers on Instagram. Zero Plans had a sold-out run of the Edinburgh Fringe in 2023 with 50+ five-star audience reviews.; Category: Comedy

title: 0 Plans: A Crowd Work and Stand-up Comedy Show
description: A crowd-work and improvised stand-up comedy show with zero plans. Join us for an intimate night of comedy where Northern Irish comedian Reece Kidd and friends will entertain you and make you laugh. Reece has over 30 million views online and over 30,000 followers on Instagram. Zero Plans had a sold-out run of the Edinburgh Fringe in 2023 with 50+ five-star audience reviews.; Category: Comedy

title: 0 to 30 – Dan Boerman's Quarter Life Crisis
description: Unhinged, in the best way, and genuinely original. Live from New Zealand - Dan Boerman debuts his high-energy solo hour in Edinburgh, after packed-out New Zealand Fringe shows! Dan has turned 30, and started going to therapy. He's not there to find a solution, he just wanted to tell a stranger he doesn't plan on changing. Join Dan Boerman in his chaotic solo hour, sharing tales as a long-haired lout all the way from NZ. 'Please come' (Dan).; Category: Comedy

title: 001 – Laughing Matters (Work in Progress)
description: I left Israel to live in Berlin, because it is ironically safer. My mother would disagree as she is a Holocaust survivor and therefore kind of needy, so I moved to the one country she would never visit me in. Come and I'll tell you all about it.; Category: Comedy

title: 007 Voices of Bond
description: Immerse yourself in the world of 007 and the legendary voices that have accompanied Bond. Goldfinger, Skyfall, Diamonds Are Forever and more brought to life by agents Ella McCready, Alex Beharrell and the Night Owl band. Night Owl Shows bring you more than just the music with a new take on the tribute genre that has won them standing ovations worldwide. This chronological trip through the music of 007 promises all the classics with fascinating facts delivered by our own onstage agents and agent M beaming on to a screen from his bunker in London. ; Category: Music

title: 01_Algorhythm.mp3
description: Ten beatboxers, armed only with their microphones, charming personalities, and about 50p to their names, set out to transcend the greatest threat to the modern day entertainment scene – the algorithm. Prepare to see just how far the human voice can be morphed, to not only produce sensational music, but override AI itself.; Category: Music

title: 1, 2, 3. Sh*t, that's my OCD
location: Just the Tonic at The Caves
description: In a world full of ugliness, desperation and people touching you with dirty hands, OCD became a coping mechanism. This young girl tries to hide her symptoms, for example touching things three times, but it's in her DNA and to her discomfort the world starts noticing. But, relax. It's a comedy. Fine, tragi-comedy. A monologue full of 1,2,3s, changing from verse to prose and focused on the PTSD of sexual abuse, which worsened the girl's Obsessive Compulsive Disorder and developed it to a place where she didn't feel "normal". Based on real stories.; Category: Theatre

title: 1.295 Reframing Autistic Success (Kitten Steps)
description:
After 2023’s sell-out show, Stags returns with laughs, adventures and his more innovative 1.295-step mission for success. Add to that some neurospicy experimentation and questioning what it means to be AuDHD in a neurotypical world, Stags finds he’s reframing everything. 'Few things more charming... With nothing but a microphone and a rain sound machine, Stags brings his audience into his memories... Audience doubled up in laughter' (Margaret Hall, Playbill). 'An immensely likeable and charismatic performer' (NeurodiverseReview.com). 'Highly recommended!!' 'Very very funny' (Audience reviews).
; Category: Comedy

title: #1 All-Time Best Comedy Champion: War of the Flags
description: Who are the funniest comedians? The Americans? The English... eh... probably the Scottish, but maybe it's the Arabs? Or the Asians? Canadians? No, it's your Irish cousin... or your Indian dad? Can't forget about the Jews! The time to wonder has run out! Comics from every nation, culture and background will go head-to-head and answer the age old question: who are the funniest people? Records won't lie, there will be one champion. Join us with your country's colors, paint your face, show us your nips and let's get ready to rumble!; Category: Comedy

title: 1 and Only Absolute Burlesque and Cabaret
description: Delighting audiences with sell-out shows since 2017, we are back! Experience the fiery passion and irresistible allure of our home-grown hotties at a burlesque show like no other. Watch as we charm, tease and captivate you with our sultry moves and magnetic charisma. Get ready for a night of sizzling performances, seductive secrets and scintillating entertainment that will leave you wanting more. Join us for one of a kind extravaganza that celebrates the art of tease and the beauty of burlesque. Share our ethos: Every body is a burlesque body!; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Awesome Magic Show for Families with Sam Hurst
presenter: Samuel Hurst (Beautiful Magicians Club) / PBH's Free Fringe
description: Samuel Hurst, UK Family Entertainer of the Year 2019 grew up watching Saturday morning TV and Magic. The only magician the world to be on both Mr Beast and Sidemen YouTube channels brings an early morning show of amazing magic, shocking dad jokes and pure joy you could only get sat in front of the TV with a bowl of cereal. This show should be in your top five list of things to see with your family. 'Takes silliness and makes it an art form' **** (BroadwayBaby.com).; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Ball Show: 1 More Encore
location: Just the Tonic at The Mash House
description: When Terence Hartnett found out that his testicular cancer had spread to his lung, he got out his notebook and started writing jokes. Two years later, 1 Ball Show has been performed at New York City's Carolines on Broadway, Chicago's Lincoln Lodge and at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe for sold-out crowds. Chemo sucks and so does losing a lung, but if you can't laugh, you might as well be dead already. 'Highly recommended show!' (FringeReview.co.uk); 'Insightful, emotional and laugh-out-loud funny!' (Comedy Clubhouse).; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Cent Comedy: Moni Zhang's (digital) Pick of Fringe
presenter: 1 Cent Comedy, Moni Zhang and Friends
description: Can't afford a trip to Scotland? Too cozy in your depression nest to leave the house? Or just a savvy Fringe-goer doing your homework? Moni Zhang's got you covered. Four daily acts: a buffet of comic flavours, handpicked by Moni Zhang. Some chosen for brilliance, some for weirdness, some because Moni's a sucker for guilt trips. Catch us on YouTube.; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Cent Comedy presents: 1001 Space Adventures: Breadlove and Poophead – Interactive Children Show
presenter: Stoopid Comedy by Mihai Tartara / Free Festival
description: Join Breadlove and Poophead in a cosmic journey where your child isn't just an audience member – they're the hero of their own interstellar adventure! Will they save the galaxy? It's up to our young space explorers! Mixing puppets, sound effects, painting and many more in this interactive sci-fi adventure filled with fun, learning and imagination.; Category: Children's Shows

title: 1 Cent Comedy presents: Black Widows
description: Welcome to the dark side of laughter, where our comics don't give a damn about your comfort zone. It's where the fearless female comics come to play, and by play we mean mercilessly toy with every dark corner of comedy there is. Expect an evening soaked in pitch-black humour, where insults are the highest form of flattery and the comedy is so twisted, it feels sinfully right. Edinburgh Fringe 2023 sell-out show! Daily rotating line-up of badass comediennes, hosted by Moni Zhang.; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Cent Comedy presents: Depression vs. Anxiety (Game Show)
presenter: Berlin Mental Health Festival and Moni Zhang Comedy
description: Think your emotional baggage is heavy? Wait 'til you see ours! Join us for a night where anxiety and depression duke it out, comedy style. It's like therapy, but cheaper and with a donation at the end. Get ready to laugh at all the wrong things for all the right reasons. Who will win? Who cares! Edinburgh Fringe 2022 sell-out show. Host by Moni Zhang with a daily rotating line-up.; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Cent Comedy presents: Mental Health Matters at Edinburgh Fringe
description: Edinburgh Fringe 2024 is where we turn mental health discussions inside out!  Get real, get raw and definitely get ready to laugh with us. Dive into the chaos and clarity of mental health, all while exploring Edinburgh city's vibrant atmosphere. Hosted by Moni Zhang.; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Cent Comedy presents: Moni Zhang: Asian Daddy, Dead
description:
Warning: Dark comedy zone! Enter at your own risk! Emerging from the ashes of her father's death, Moni Zhang brings you a dark and hilarious comedy show that will leave you gasping for air. With twisted and taboo humour, she makes light of her traumatic past, mental-health struggles and her relationship with her dead daddy. Edinburgh Festival Fringe 2023 sell-out show.
; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Cent Comedy presents: Normal Dysfunctional Family (Game Show)
presenter: Stoopid Comedy by Mihai Tartara / Free Festival
description: A comedy game show where comedians battle each other using childhood trauma and the audience decide who had the worst parents. Sold-out run Edinburgh Fringe 2023. Three rounds. Round One: a five-minute stand-up set about family and childhood. Round Two: prepared scenarios containing a location and a subject, and our comedians have to improvise a family fight scene based on the notes. Round Three: similar to the game Scenes We'd Like to See from Mock the Week, but only with family topics.; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Cynic, 1 Mystic: A Late Night Comedy Extravaganza
description: The world-famous 'Magdalena the fortune teller' is finally coming to Fringe! She will show you the future, as a very cynical German comedian reminds you of the past. And trust us, by the end you will realize how funny the present really is. 'An unexpected mixture and a fascinating show' (Scotsman).; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Date: The 18+ Game Show (Free!)
presenter: Look At That Productions / PBH's Free Fringe
location: PBH's Free Fringe @ Liquid Room Annexe/Warehouse
description: Not for the easily offended, this hilarious brand-new dating show sees the audience play naughty games, five guys compete for a date, and overall chaos. If you love to laugh, compete and – of course – join in a sing-along, this is the perfect way to begin your evening at the Fringe. We recommend having a drink before you come!; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Date: The 18+ Game Show (Free!)
presenter: Look At That Productions / PBH's Free Fringe
description: Not for the easily offended, this hilarious brand-new dating show sees the audience play naughty games, five guys compete for a date, and overall chaos. If you love to laugh, compete and – of course – join in a sing-along, this is the perfect way to begin your evening at the Fringe. We recommend having a drink before you come!; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Dazzling Cabaret Show
description:
'Life is a cabaret, old chum, come to the Cabaret!' Come be treated to a night of creativity, diversity and artistic impression – from sultry dancers to dazzling singers and hilarious comedians. Featuring a mix of music, dance, comedy and tantalising performances, this show will treat you to a diverse range of acts: from glamorous dancers to soulful singers as well as cheeky comedians and seductive burlesque performers. This show exudes playfulness, sensuality and empowerment in a vibrant and inclusive environment. A show that promise to entertain and intrigue all tastes.
; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Hour of Insane Magic
description: After a sell-out sensation at the Edinburgh Fringe 2023, Insane Magic are back even bigger and even more Insane! Witness some of the most incredible acts of magic from 'three of the best magicians in the country' (EdinburghLive.com). Cameron Gibson, Elliot Bibby and Luke Osey return with everything from insane magic tricks and impossible illusions, to amazing acts of mind-reading, this is a show that's 'so insanely good' (WorldMagicReview.com) it has to be seen to be believed!; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Hour of Insane Magic: After Dark
description: After their sell-out sensation at the Edinburgh Fringe 2023, Insane Magic are back... but this time After Dark! Join the Insane Magic boys – along with some hand-picked special guests from the world of magic, circus and variety – for an hour of naughty, wild and sometimes extreme late-night magic. This show is full of stuff a little too raunchy for their daytime show! May contain: adult themes, naughty language, traces of nuts and a little nudity... and one cast member doesn't go to the gym!; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 in a Chameleon
description: How do we uncover our true colours in a world full of reasons to hide? A life-affirming, thought-provoking comedy about trying to blend in everywhere yet belonging nowhere, from engineer, entrepreneur (Forbes 30 Under 30) and award-winning storyteller Narie Foster in her Edinburgh Fringe debut. Born in New York to Thai and Canadian scientists, Foster takes us on a multifaceted exploration of freedom, authenticity and scantily camouflaged metaphors. 'Beautifully written. Raw and honest. Naturally hilarious.' **** (InReview.com.au).; Category: Theatre

title: 1 Irish 1 English: Afternoons
description: Join us at 16.35 for a stand up comedy show featuring English comedian Ollie Fox and Irish comedian Reece Kidd. They have over 25 million views online, 27K+ Followers, and a British Comedy Guide award under their belts, with two sold-out shows last year at the Edinburgh Fringe.; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Irish, 1 English: Evenings
description: Join us at 20:15 for a stand up comedy show featuring English comedian Ollie Fox and Irish comedian Reece Kidd. They have over 30 million views online, 30K+ followers, and a British Comedy Guide award under their belts, with two sold-out shows last year at the Edinburgh Fringe.; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Irish, 1 English: Mornings
location: Just the Tonic at Cabaret Voltaire
description: Join us at 11am for a stand-up comedy show featuring English comedian Ollie Fox and Irish comedian Reece Kidd. With over 25 million views online, 27,000 followers, a British Comedy Guide Award under their belts, and sold-out shows last year in Edinburgh, London and Barcelona. 'Formidable' (NottsComedyReview.wordpress.com).; Category: Comedy

title: 1 *Irishman: A Stand-up Comedy Show
description: 1 *Irishman: is a stand-up comedy show featuring Northern Irish comedian Reece Kidd supported by his favourite Irish comedians. Reece has 30 million views online and had two sold-out Edinburgh shows in 2023 which received over 80+ five-star reviews from audience members. This is a work in progress show so there will be plenty of crowd work and interaction with the audience. ; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Lung Run
description: After beating cancer twice (losing a lung and a testicle in the process) NYC comedian Terence Hartnett is starting to run again in his new home: Vienna. An ex-pat, a cancer survivor and a runner walk into a bar... 'Whip-smart and emotionally intelligent, Hartnett is not to be missed.' (Comedy Clubhouse).; Category: Comedy

title: 1 Moment in Time
description: In his brand new, thought-provoking show, magician and mind illusionist Sean Alexander reflects on the defining moments in time that shape each and every one of us. With jaw dropping magic throughout, each instance intertwined with powerful metaphors and storytelling, this show is unlike anything else. Discover your moments in time all over again... 'You are incredible, I will have you attend the palace' (HRH Princess Michael of Kent). 'Incredibly talented' (Stephen Mulhern). 'I love magic that tells a story and I really like you' (Simon Cowell).; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Murder: The Mind-Reading Lawyer
description: Fringe veteran mind reader, Tomas McCabe, is back with a show that combines his trademark mentalism with a courtroom drama. Having been the go-to Fringe performer for mind reading for four years running, Tomas has now taken his skills to the next level by training as a barrister. Expect a family-friendly show of incredible mentalism mixed with the drama of court. Are you brave enough to sit as the judge or jury, or will you be the one on trial?; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 1 Murder: The Mind-Reading Lawyer
description: Fringe veteran mind reader, Tomas McCabe, is back with a show that combines his trademark mentalism with a courtroom drama. Having been the go-to Fringe performer for mind reading for four years running, Tomas has now taken his skills to the next level by training as a barrister. Expect a family-friendly show of incredible mentalism mixed with the drama of court. Are you brave enough to sit as the judge or jury, or will you be the one on trial?; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: #1 Son – Natasha Mercado
description: LA clown Natasha Mercado invites you to a mass that’s equal parts holy and horny – hosted by God’s sexiest son, Father Greg Orian. Experience a religious awakening like no other. Desire and devotion. Sacred, yet profane. It's like church, but with 'smash or pass' revelations about lust, lies and living with your demons... As seen on HBO Max and [adult swim].; Category: Comedy

title: 10,000 Digits of Pi
description: 'This guy will do anything for a laugh, and it works' **** (FringeToronto.com). 'This show is certainly unique. Because the set of numbers and audience-chosen punishments change between shows, every performance is different. Sagar doesn’t seem to play a character, and the audience is involved throughout. This is one of those shows that blurs the line between audience and performer, and makes you wonder if it’s a play or even a comedy show altogether. It’s a nice respite from the otherwise formality of theatre' (PatronAndPearl.com).; Category: Comedy

title: 10,000 Digits of Pi
description: 'This guy will do anything for a laugh, and it works' **** (FringeToronto.com). 'This show is certainly unique. Because the set of numbers and audience-chosen punishments change between shows, every performance is different. Sagar doesn’t seem to play a character, and the audience is involved throughout. This is one of those shows that blurs the line between audience and performer, and makes you wonder if it’s a play or even a comedy show altogether. It’s a nice respite from the otherwise formality of theatre' (PatronAndPearl.com).; Category: Comedy

title: 10,000 Ideas by Robyn Perkins
description: Winner: Best Comedy, Shaftesbury Fringe 2023. In her latest hour of critically acclaimed stand-up, London-based comedian Robyn Perkins invites you to ask her anything, and she’ll do the rest. Previous questions (answered truthfully) include: 'Would America be better off if it didn’t elect its own presidents?', 'Can we draft your wedding vows?' and even 'Who’s the hottest audience member?'. Same title, different show. Participation is optional. But audiences can’t help getting involved in Perkins’ energetic, eclectic and absolutely enthralling show. Reviews of 10,000 Ideas: 'Downright hilarious' **** (FringeFeed.com.au). 'She makes some excellent noises.' **** (One4Review.co.uk).; Category: Comedy

title: 10 Party Games – Jollybox!
location: PBH's Free Fringe @ Liquid Room Annexe/Warehouse
description: The comedy game show where the audience play along! Quip, quiz and draw your way to victory as we find the funny in everything! Artistic talent not required. Bring a charged smartphone and join us!; Category: Comedy

title: 10 Pound Baby
description: The average C-section in the USA costs £25-40K, but you can just squat one out in the back like a feral cat for FREE! Comedian and skinflint Leah Renee returns to Fringe with a new hour about the price of believing in yourself. Show reviewers called it 'Funny, daring and quite surprising in places' with 'laugh out loud moments...wryness, poignancy, shock and tenderness' (EdFringeReview.co.uk).; Category: Comedy

title: 10 Songs for Geeks – Jollyboat
location: PBH's Free Fringe @ Liquid Room Annexe/Warehouse
description: Fringe legends Jollyboat bring their best comedy songs from 14 years of touring and sold-out Fringe shows. Catchy tunes, witty lyrics and high-energy fun from start to finish. Help us celebrate the things that make us laugh, and find out why so many people return year after year! ***** (BroadwayBaby.com). ***** (GeekChocolate.co.uk). ***** (InformedEdinburgh.co.uk).; Category: Comedy

title: 10 Things They Hate About Me
description: When it comes to relationships, Shinanne is all about the D... disappointment! She's a 40-year-old, single "lady" on a journey of reflection. Her eggs are hanging on like contestants in Gladiators... even her cultural references are old! The show is a hilarious account of the trials and tribulations of dating in a Tinder reality after growing up in a kissing in the disco world. Inevitably she begins to ask 'what's wrong with me?' So begins the introspective, somewhat ridiculous and comical list of "flaws" that expose Shinanne's weaknesses in the modern dating era.; Category: Comedy

title: 100% C*ntinental
description: What’s the difference between expats and immigrants? Can Americans get deported from countries? What even is Europe after being dumped by the UK? These global comedians are putting their lives (or at least their dignity) on the line to find out. 100% C*ntinental is a stand-up comedy mix show, unpacking the experiences of international women adjusting to life, love and paperwork via Google Translate. Find out if it's true that Italians are sexy and Germans are humourless, and what would happen if Emily went to Paris on minimum wage.; Category: Comedy

title: 100% My Type On Paper
location: C ARTS | C venues | C alto
description: Sammy and Clyde are on their first date. It’s cute. It’s awkward. It’s bad jokes and forced laughter. Sweaty hands and wondering who gets the next round. It’s 'I really want to kiss her' and 'I hope he doesn’t try to kiss me'. It’s excruciating, but that’s a first date, right? As Sammy and Clyde get to know each other again, and again, their reality slowly falls to pieces. Missed jokes become hilarious one-liners. Awkward silences become witty repartee. The customers become an audience. Everyone starts watching – and Sammy and Clyde? They become disposable.; Category: Theatre

title: 100% The Greatest Comedian Alive or Dead (No Refunds)
description: Bristol comedian and club favourite Burt Williamson, 'hilarious at every turn' **** (Scotsman), performs his second hour of stand-up comedy. Silly and serious, smart and stupid, Burt packs dense punchlines with goofy charm to great comedic effect. At the forefront of a new and exciting generation of comics emerging from Bristol, Burt leads the charge on a new wave of talent in British comedy in this exciting solo hour. 'The funniest, most unlikely, rudest yet sweetest' **** (Entertainment-Now.com). 'Absurd and excellent' (Rife Magazine). 'Affable and poised' **** (Bristol365). ***** (EdFringeReview.com).; Category: Comedy

title: 100 Things You are Overthinking – An Improv Stand-up Comedy Game Show!
description: Fifth year on the Fringe! Join our comics as they battle it out, creating comedy from any thought you have. Just write them anonymously on pieces of paper we provide and watch the comics create a set on the spot, just for you! Entry without tickets is not guaranteed, as we have regulars that religiously come back every evening for a completely different show. 'Very funny but also thought-provoking' (Scotsman).; Category: Comedy

title: 100 Things You are Overthinking – An Improv Stand-up Comedy Game Show!
description: Fifth year on the Fringe! Join our comics as they battle it out, creating comedy from any thought you have. Just write them anonymously on pieces of paper we provide and watch the comics create a set on the spot, just for you! Entry without tickets is not guaranteed, as we have regulars that religiously come back every evening for a completely different show. 'Very funny but also thought-provoking' (Scotsman).; Category: Comedy

title: The 100-Year-Old Letter
description: In 1916, Christabel Mennell writes a letter of apology to Katie Marsh. It is finally delivered in 2021 and becomes a global news sensation. Travelling from Bath to London, via two world wars and two pandemics, the unreceived letter of apology sparked people’s imaginations, opening up a fascinating mystery: what was the apology for? Who were the women writing to one another? What became of them? After a year of speculation and research, Good Wolf peels back the layers of time to reveal a funny, moving story of history, war, faith, friendship and porridge oats.; Category: Theatre

title: 100 Years of Disney
description: Celebrating over 100 years since the iconic Disney title sequence first graced our screens, award-winning international vocal ensemble Octavoce present another whirlwind a cappella trip through our favourite Disney tunes. A sell-out at the Fringe 2023, we'll take you from earlier films like Cinderella and Jungle Book, to the Disney Renaissance of the 90s, right up to more recent films such as Brave and Frozen. We know Disney animations hold a very special place in the hearts of many generations so we welcome all ages. Come on down and tap into that Disney nostalgia.; Category: Music

title: 100 Years of Musicals!
description: In their Fringe debut, the UK's No.1 show choir invites you on a joyous journey through the rich history of musical theatre, in a fun-packed a cappella show for all the family! Starting back in the raucous days of the music hall, this high energy revue features much-loved and well-known songs from genre defining composers like Gershwin and Lloyd Webber – all the way through to big, modern day musical titans like Lin Manuel Miranda. Join us for a glorious celebration of the very best of West End magic!; Category: Music

title: 1000% Musical Comedy from David Hoare
description: Award-winning David Hoare returns with another bumper show, brimming with silliness. He aims to bring you maximum musical comedy! Last year’s show 1 Billion Songs Please! was a rousing success and 2022's show 100 Songs in an Hour had a sell-out run! Don’t miss this early afternoon hour of joyfully rude songs. 'An annoyingly funny young man' (Gary Delaney). 'David has that magic combination of quick wit and observational insight' (EdFringeReview.com). 'With some slick one-liners and aggression akin to Bo Burnham, James Acaster or Tim Vine' (DeadlineNews.co.uk).; Category: Comedy

title: 101 Comedy Club – Free
presenter: Ian Miller / Mat Wills / Laughing Horse
description: 'Funny. Fast. Free' **** (ThreeWeeks). 'Picture BBC's Live at the Apollo' **** (DeadlineNews.co.uk). Each night sees four experienced acts performing. All our comedians have been hand-picked from an ethical, fair-trade farm where they've been grown in only the finest organic dog poo. All our fart jokes are sustainable due to our unique carbon offset scheme. Each time one of us blows off, a tree is planted in Dagenham, Essex.; Category: Comedy

title: 101 Ways to Annoy Your Parents and Other Really Old People
description: Title says it all! *Evil laugh*. Don't worry, I'll also teach the parents how to annoy their kids as well. From multi award-winning kids comedian Matty Grey. Laugh your guts out of your butthole as he brings the chaos of his mind to the Edinburgh Fringe. 'Matty Grey is the master of children's entertainment and he knocks it out of the park' ***** (Advertiser, Adelaide). 'Matty Grey is loud, enthusiastic, and will (mildly) insult your children!' ***** (PlayAndGo.com.au). Winner: Best Kids Show, Adelaide Fringe 2023.; Category: Children's Shows

title: 101 Ways to Annoy Your Parents and Other Really Old People – The Christmas Special
description: It's all in the title (hahahahahahahaha). 101 Ways to Annoy Your Parents and Other Really Old People is back, and this time we're taking on Christmas – in August?! Matty Grey brings the second chapter in his award-winning series to England... (agent whispers into Matty's ear while typing). 'What's that? Scotland isn't a part of England?! No, I didn't see the end of Braveheart.' Winner: Best Kids Show, Adelaide Fringe 2023, Perth Fringe 2020 and 2017. 'Matty Grey will mildly insult your kids' (Advertiser, Adelaide).; Category: Children's Shows

title: 10th Annual Haters' Ball
description: The crown jewel of comedy... The smash hit stand-up event 10 years in the making... The show that Gerard Butler declared to be 'the most fun I've ever had compacted into one hour'... Now celebrating a decade of comedy, chaos, and hilarity, it's The 10th Annual Haters' Ball. Four hilarious headline comedians compete to be named the biggest 'Hater' in comedy. Fully interactive, no two shows are the same. 'Brutally funny' (Scotsman). 'Raucous, dick-swinging comedy' (Chortle.co.uk). 'Every show is guaranteed to be unique and hysterical' (Dircksey.com.au).; Category: Comedy

title: 11 Lessons on Being Loud (from an American Opera Singer)
description: Knockout opera-singing stand-up comedian Steph DePrez is back with a new show about dreams, risks and how exactly Americans learn to be so… loud. Steph weaves stories about confidence and failure in between opera arias, gospel hymns and jazz standards 'performed with the gravitas afforded by possessing a diaphragm like a blacksmith’s bellows' (TheWeeReview.com). Audience reviews: 'Well worth a trip off the beaten track'. 'Hilarious chats, heavenly singing. A real hidden gem'. 'Never thought of combining stand-up comedy with opera, but Steph does it beautifully! A ton of laughs'. ; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 11pm Live at the Big Cave
location: Just the Tonic at The Caves
description: End your day at the Festival in style at our iconic Edinburgh venue with the very best in stand-up talent. Expect top TV names, Netflix stars, and gems of the festival in this 90-minute late-night boozy extravaganza where anything goes! Rub shoulders and boogie with the artists until the wee hours!; Category: Comedy

title: 12th Year! John Hunt Four O'Clock Afternoon Blues and Swing
description: 'Fantastic!' (Jools Holland). 'Boogie-woogie slide-guitar master' **** (Scotsman). 'The Fringe's most unique, inventive and soulful blues performer, a fantastic gig' **** (BroadwayBaby.com). Hunt's 12th Fringe following 11 years of full-house performances. 'Blues legend built his own cannibalised, recycled guitars from a B&Q shelf and papier-mache' **** (Herald). 'Instantly evocative of the deep south blues. Unique R'n'B take on Sinatra alongside a James Bond mash-up. Whatever Hunt plays, it feels refreshingly authentic' **** (List). 'Ingenious 21st-century blues' **** (ThreeWeeks). 'Like Seasick Steve in a science lab, a storming set' (Ian Rankin).; Category: Music

title: 13th Morning
description: 13th Morning comes, naturally, after the Twelfth Night. Sebastian and Olivia are married after she had been in love initially with Viola. Is it bad that she can't stop thinking about her husband's sister? Meanwhile, Antonio returns from his trips across the sea to share with Sebastian this new thing called "being gay"! They recall a time when they might have been just that. And Malvolio is still trying to figure out a way to seek his revenge, but all he's managed to do is learn to play shitty acoustic covers of Oasis songs. Or just one.; Category: Theatre

title: 15 – Equinox
description:
Contemporary Edinburgh artist Davy Macdonald celebrates his 15th annual solo exhibition with a stunning new collection of abstract, conceptual and figurative oil paintings. A richly imaginative and inspiring collection of narrative landscapes, soulful portraits and abstract expressionistic paintings bursting with colour, pattern and musical rhythm. Over the past decade or so, Davy has developed his own very distinctive aesthetic, criss-crossing genres with surreal and sensual, dramatic and dreamlike vision. A diverse and unique exhibition not to be missed.
; Category: Exhibitions

title: 16 Postcodes
description: Twenty years, 16 postcodes, one city. In her debut storytelling show, Jessica Regan (BBC, Channel 4, Guilty Feminist) shares lessons lived and learned from a life in no particular order. Each show is drawn from true tales of love and landlords, of mice and men and more, told with help from the audience who will play their part in her odyssey as she moves North, South, East and West, finding out which is best. This is a journey through an impenetrable city with an all-too-open heart. You'll laugh, you'll cry, you rent cos you can't afford to buy...; Category: Theatre

title: 160th Edinburgh International Exhibition of Photography 2024
description: Edinburgh Photographic Society's first international photography exhibition was shown in 1861. This is the 160th running of this prestigious international print exhibition. Invited judges select around 160 of the best photos out of thousands entered. Entry is open to all from March until June. We have two categories, Mono and Colour with up to four entries in each. Any genre is eligible. Images must originate as captures by light and the copyright owned by the submitting photographer. A printed A4 colour catalogue is included in the entry fee. ; Category: Exhibitions

title: 1954: Ella, Etta, Eartha
description: It's the year 1954. Ella Fitzgerald, Etta James and Eartha Kitt are all at the dizzy heights of their careers. With swinging jazz, powerful soul and cheeky kitsch, these women broke new ground for all who followed. Award-winning singer/actor Melissa Western and her musicians pay tribute to this magnificent era in music and inspiring trio of pioneering singers. 50s style abounds. 'Western is a force of nature... Great storyteller, feisty, highly enjoyable' ***** (BroadwayBaby.com). 'Absolutely brilliant… Her aptitude for music is vast and versatile' ***** (ThreeWeeks). 'Western's gorgeous singing voice serves her well' (TheAustralian.com.au).; Category: Cabaret and Variety

1984 is a compelling physical theatre adaptation of George Orwell's classic, performed by Slavic actors. With inspiration from Nick Hern's adaptation, it delves into themes of surveillance and control, offering a haunting and immersive experience that challenges perceptions of truth and reality. Through expressive movement and visceral choreography, audiences are transported into Orwell's dystopian universe, feeling the oppressive atmosphere of Big Brother's world firsthand. This innovative fusion of physicality and narrative captivates spectators, leaving a lasting impact and sparking thought-provoking conversations about the state of our society and the dangers of unchecked power.; Category: Theatre

title: 199 Jokes Before Lunchtime: High Whisk
description: An insect joke? Tick. A tartan joke? Check. A joke about giraffes in a bar? That's a tall order. Danny Matinee takes you to the grocer (who sells him a dodgy razor, bloody cheek), Nando's (with the menu on the ceiling, he needs a peri-periscope) and beyond in his new show, full of one-liners, puns, props and pictures. Suitable for all ages, especially fans of Masai Graham, Milton Jones and Tim Vine. Might include free coffee. By the author/performer of solo shows at the Brighton Fringe, Edinburgh Fringe and Leicester Comedy Festival.; Category: Comedy

title: 1k Comedy Presents: Toby Shure and Friends – Love Ireland!
description: Are you looking for love in all the wrong places? Toby was, until he discovered the ancient lost Gaelic secrets to love, life and the universe. Fringe legend Toby Shure invites you to join him and some of his favourite comedians from around the world for a crazy party of a good time. Dating-themed stand-up compilation show, come for laughter and leave with a partner. Three sold out Fringe runs – get your tickets in advance to avoid disappointment! ‘You’ll probably get cancelled’ (Prince Abdi). ***** (Cambridge Footlights).; Category: Comedy

title: 1st Dates: Asian Bachelor
description: 31, single, and lives with his mother. Sounds like a catch? Join Lance on his quest to find "the one" during (yes, during) this stand-up show about Chinese culture, dating, mental health, aspiration and struggle through the lens of a first-generation Chinese immigrant family. Why is he still single? Is it the stereotypes? His personality? Does he just have high standards? 'He needs a real therapist' * (an Uber driver). 'What kind of man defames his family' * (His mother). 'Here are five asterisks' *****, 'One day he will be a *' (Himself). 'Disturbing' (Audience member).; Category: Comedy

title: 2/3rds of a Threesome (and Friends)
description: A raucous evening of music, comedy and musical comedy hosted by AJ Holmes (Book of Mormon, StarKid) and Caitlin Cook (The Writing on the Stall). Featuring their funniest and most famous friends from Hollywood, Broadway, stand-up, musical theatre, clown and everything in between; this musical variety spectacle regularly sells out shows in NY, LA, London and Edinburgh. Past guests include Daniel Sloss, Ilana Glazer, David Cross, Phil Wang, Janeane Garofalo, Reggie Watts, Flo & Joan, Mark Normand, Larry Dean, Catherine Cohen, Ivo Graham and more. You never know who is going turn up!; Category: Comedy

title: 2.7 Men
presenter: Louis George, Will Scambler and Louisa Corr
description: These three rising stars of the London comedy circuit return to Edinburgh following a sell-out run last year to do two things: blow their life savings on an Airbnb, and perform an hour of mind-melting stand-up comedy. And guess what? Their direct debit's just gone through... Join Louis George (SYTYF? semi-finalist), Will Scambler (Chortle Student Comedy finalist) and Louisa Corr (as seen in This Time With Alan Partridge) for this tantalising triple bill. There's something for everyone! And, thanks to the gender pay gap, you've got three acts for the price of just 2.7 men.; Category: Comedy

title: 2 and a Half Women
presenter: Mari Volar, Ann Vaida, Annick Adelle
description: Three queer international comedians (Ann Vaida, Annick Adelle and Mari Volar) bring their WIP shows to Edinburgh and band together to make their solo debuts less harrowing. Mari Volar is presenting the world with a feminist manifesto for all aspiring trophy wives. Ann Vaida invites you along to exist in a completely arbitrary sh*tstorm of a society, and other jokes. Annick Adelle offers the world stand-up shows where true magic unfolds. A show made up of three comedians. One will show up to your show. These really are some of the best odds in showbusiness.; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Artists, 2 Concerts, 2 Premieres
presenter: Johan Hartman – Bass Baritone, Ailsa Aitkenhead – Piano
description: Rising American opera star and composer Johan Hartman is joined by Edinburgh’s Ailsa Aitkenhead in two varied programs. Featured works include Mr Hartman’s song cycles on poems by WB Yeats and Robert Browning, as well as lieder and songs by Franz Schubert and Gerald Finzi.; Category: Music

title: 2 Become Wand: Hudson & Hudson – Magic
description: When real-life married funny magicians decided to perform a double-act, they thought it would be the perfect combination of fun and tricks. However, their personal-life bickering tends to get in the way of the magic. 'Climaxes ranging from silly to mind-blowing. Two immensely engaging and talented performers' **** (BroadwayBaby.com). 'You fooled us' Penn & Teller. 'Ace. Brilliant. Authentic' (Amanda Holden).; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Funny Feckers
presenter: Wes Dalton / Sergi Polo / Free Festival
description: The craic is back after a sell-out run in 2023 with 60 minutes of non-stop laughs from two hilarious comics seen on RTE, BBC, and ITV – Wes Dalton (creator of sell-out show 4 Funny Feckers) and Barcelona's Sergi Polo. Hosted by Wes, an international Irish comedian returning with tales of his Asian comedy tour/mid-life crisis and featuring Sergi, an award-winning one-liner comic and internet sensation, plus a different guest comedian nightly. This is an amazing hour of comedy with something for everyone: spine-tingling crowd work, cheekiness and stories from Wes, and brilliant one-liners from Sergi. ; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Guys 1 Pub
presenter: Richy Sheehy and Mark O'Keeffe / Free Festival
description: Two award-winning comics deal late-night craic in the mid-afternoon, a wild mix of dark, satirical stand-up and musical comedy. 'These guys are going to be huge' (David McSavage). 'Cork's finest export' (RedFM.ie).; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Guys, 3 Drams: The Ultimate Live Blues and Whisky Experience
description: 2022 and 2023 Fringe sell-out show. Join duo The Rhythm and Booze Project as they play some stomping blues music and serve you three superb Scotch whiskies. In a whirlwind 65 minutes, get ready to learn how to sound clever about whisky, appreciate top-quality drams, and enjoy some raucous tunes. 'If you like blues and you like whisky then you’ve got to see this show' **** (BroadwayBaby.com). 'This provided the most euphoric experience I have ever had at the Fringe' ***** (MumbleMusic.net).; Category: Music

title: 2 Muslim 2 Furious
presenter: Aisha Amanduri and Hasan Al-Habib / Free Festival
description: Aisha and Hasan prove that not all British Muslims perform useful jobs, like doctors, nurses or playing for Liverpool. But just try to name a funnier Kazakh-Iraqi double act… we’ll wait! 2M2F is a work-in-progress stand-up comedy show from: Birmingham Comedy Festival Breaking Talent Award 2023 winner Hasan Al-Habib and Funny Women One-To-Watch 2023 Aisha Amanduri. 'Deliciously funny' (Guardian, no surprise they're fans). 'Clever, edgy and unexpected' (Kemah Bob of BBC’s Richard Osman's House of Games, FOC It Up! podcast). 'Super talented' (Mae Martin of Channel 4’s Taskmaster).; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Slut Drops and a Chicken Burger
description: Slut drop it like it's hot! Kirsty talks about sexy times, nights out and starting a fight with a yoga instructor. 'An absolute joy from start to finish. 100% highlight of the Fringe' (Audience review, 2023). 'Kirsty is a fantastic high-energy act, she was a huge hit with the Fat Penguin audience' (Jay Handley, Fat Penguin Comedy Club). 'High-energy storytelling and subjects from cringe to pure genius. You will absolutely love her!' (Who Knows Comedy). Finalist, Some-Antics Comedy Slam 2023. ; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
description: Funny, but is it true? Three headline comedians step on stage. Two are telling the truth, one is a big fat liar. Can you tell who...? The award-winning interactive comedy compilation sell-out show returns to a brand-new air-conditioned venue on the Grassmarket! The perfect show for fans of BBC's Would I Lie To You? Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
description: Funny, but is it true? Three headline comedians step on stage. Two are telling the truth, one is a big fat liar. Can you tell who...? The award-winning interactive comedy compilation sell-out show returns to a brand-new air-conditioned venue on the Grassmarket! The perfect show for fans of BBC's Would I Lie To You? Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
description: Funny, but is it true? Three headline comedians step on stage. Two are telling the truth, one is a big fat liar. Can you tell who...? The award-winning interactive comedy compilation sell-out show returns to a brand-new air-conditioned venue on the Grassmarket! The perfect show for fans of BBC's Would I Lie To You? Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Truths, 1 Lie
description: Funny, but is it true? Three headline comedians step on stage. Two are telling the truth, one is a big fat liar. Can you tell who...? The award-winning interactive comedy compilation sell-out show returns to a brand-new air-conditioned venue on the Grassmarket! The perfect show for fans of BBC's Would I Lie To You? Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 2 White Guys Rapping: Whose Rhyme is it Anyway?
description: If Eminem and Whose Line is it Anyway had a baby... this is what you'd get!  Award-winning performer Daniel Delby and acclaimed Aussie freestyle rap superstar Macshane have joined forces to create the most interactive freestyle comedy show on Earth! Expect high energy, improvised chaos as their lightning-quick wits and razor-sharp mic skills battle it out for the ultimate victory - your laughs! 'I believe it is one of the best events this Fringe season' ****½ (FringeFeed.com.au).; Category: Comedy

title: 2 Wongs and a White
presenter: 2 Wongs and a White / Free Festival
description: Get ready to laugh with Two Wongs and A White: a stand-up comedy show featuring Australia’s funniest comedians. Each night Jenny Tian, Patrick Golamco and Nick Schuller bring you the best of Australian humour. They’ve been on TV, toured internationally, sold out festival runs and written for telly. 'Delivery is spot-on' ****½ (TheatreMatters.com.au). 'Perfectly timed' ****½ (TheAge.com.au). ***** (Scotsman).; Category: Comedy

title: 20 Years of the Free Fringe Festival – Charity Gala Show
presenter: Laughing Horse Comedy / Free Festival / 20 Years Celebration
description: A huge gala show with all proceeds going to the Sepsis Trust, celebrating 20 years of the Laughing Horse's Free Edinburgh Festival Fringe. Featuring a host of big-name comedians and faces from the past two decades of the Free Fringe Festival coming together for a good cause and an unmissable one-off celebration looking back at the last 20 years of the Free Fringe Festival, an organisation that has helped to change the face of the Edinburgh Fringe. Then, join the after-party with the performers and DJs until 3am.; Category: Comedy

title: 200% and Bloody Will Be Thy End
description: Star-cross'd storytellers take you through multiple anarchic, humorous and contradictory re-enactments of a midsummer night they'd rather forget. Cross-cutting personal anecdotes of love, dances with death, dressing up and living their best life. ; Category: Theatre

title: 200 Puns in One Hour with Roger Swift
description: The comedic prop-pun lunatic Roger Swift shoots out 200 puns in one hour! With his trademark crazy homemade props, audio cues and PowerPoint slides. Expect corny jokes and silliness; with no theme besides wordplay. Do not expect someone taking himself seriously. Dave's Funniest Joke of the Fringe list 2016 and 2023.; Category: Comedy

title: 2018: Launch on Warning
description: False missile alert. Hawaii, 2018. Four teenagers shelter in a walk-in freezer in this The Breakfast Club-meets-Oppenheimer exploration of human connection, existentialism, and whether we act in ways that align with who we think we are in emergencies.; Category: Theatre

title: 2024 Greek Comedian of The Year, Greek in The Sheets – George Zacharopoulos
description: Brand new show about my love of life, my fear of death and the time I was accused of terrorism and espionage by the Australian Federal Police. Sold-out in Melbourne International Comedy Festival. 'Accomplished stand-up at quite a frenetic pace' ***** (One4Review.co.uk). 'A masterclass in comedic storytelling' ***** (TheQR.co.uk). 'Wicked sense of humour' ***** (TheReviewsHub.com). 'It is simply brilliant' **** (EdFringe Review).; Category: Comedy

title: 21: The Music of Adele
description: Heartfelt homage to one of music’s most-awarded females. Hits Rolling In the Deep, Someone Like You and Set Fire to The Rain sung by the awe-inspiring Ella McCready and the Night Owl Band. Night Owl Shows bring more than just the music with a take on the tribute genre that has won them awards and sold out shows worldwide. Experience why Adele captured so many souls in this powerful voyage through a modern classic set delivered from the heart of a genuine fan, with an unbelievable ability to reach emotions touched only by Adele herself.; Category: Music

title: 22 (Brooke's Version)
description: New York comedian/Moth StorySLAM Champ's debut comedy hour follows sold-out short-form workshops. Come laugh with Brooke as she trips and falls fighting spacetime continuum, economy, patriarchy, fertility, herself, while trying to get a date. In her pop-culture/Broadway mental musical (Swifties enjoy an invisibly-strung Eras tour), Brooke campaigns to lead a better future. Join Brooke's New Year's Eve-celebration, reflection, resolution. She'd like to change her life New Year's Day. Ideally, February 2nd. Audience reviews: 'Smart comedy for smart people'; 'Wild ride'; 'Fast-paced, quick-witted stand-up/storytelling mashup'; 'Never experienced anything like that'; 'Highly inspirational message.' Previous: **** (Skinny, TheatreWeekly.com, LondonTheatre1.com).; Category: Comedy

title: 22 Mirrors – A Musical Journey Through the Tarot
location: The Speakeasy at The Royal Scots Club
description: Joined by two musicians and two dancers, Brazilian singer/songwriter Giulia Drummond takes us through a ritualistic performance exploring the 22 Major Arcana of the Tarot. Expect an entrancing and intriguing experience, a magical journey through symbols and sonorities.; Category: Music

title: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee
description: Rachel Sheinkin and William Finn's musical The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee tells the story of six middle-schoolers growing up and of the relationships they form with each other, with their families and with the three adults running the Bee. With audience participation and improv elements, it is a heartwarming and hilarious tale of childhood motivations, friendship, making yourself proud and juiceboxes!; Category: Musicals and Opera

title: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee
description: Please spell 'entertaining'! The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee follows six quirky and sometimes obnoxious students in their quest for the coveted first place trophy. Accompanied by three even quirkier adults, audience members, juice boxes, community service requirements, magic feet, and the unfortunate effects of puberty, the spellers must make their way through a series of increasingly difficult (and hilarious) words, whilst also dealing with their own stressful, embarrassing, or occasionally upsetting personal lives. This show is guaranteed to leave you laughing, crying and wondering if 'hasenpfeffer' is even a real word.; Category: Musicals and Opera

title: "26" Songs Nicole Cassandra Smit Wants to Sing
description: Scotland's Queen of Blues, Nicole Cassandra Smit turns her hand on jazz, interpreting standards from Dinah Washington to Monica Zetterlund to Astrud Gilberto. The stellar new quintet will include Vid Gobac on drums, Cameron Bradley on bass, Dave Toule on guitar and Kassandra E'Silva on saxophone.; Category: Music

location: C ARTS | C venues | C aurora
description: As Jam’s 28th birthday approaches, he announces to his flatmates Hank and Morgan that he's going to kill himself instead, earning a place in the 27 Club, and getting the three of them famous. Bickering and hijinks lead them closer and closer to a birthday party themed around dead celebrities, revelations about themselves and their friendship, and an utterly unforgettable drunken self-tape for Virgin Media. 27 is the story of three young artists and their ridiculous exploits as they try to break into the industry.; Category: Theatre

title: 2Flamenco
description: Powerful, exquisite, beautiful and unforgettable Flamenco experience. Inma Montero and Danielo Olivera, well known Flamenco artists and Fringe regulars for more than a decade, bring a fresh, elegant and original vision to the main styles of Flamenco, creating a magical, intimate and special atmosphere. Experience an uplifting, moving and highly entertaining trip into the essences of Flamenco, where guitar, singing and dance coordinate spontaneously with sensitiveness, humour and complicity in a genuine twist without forgetting its pure roots, providing audiences a glimpse of Flamenco's origins and even the future. A treat for music and dance lovers. Fiesta time!; Category: Dance, Physical Theatre and Circus

title: 2lian Stern Keeps 2rying
description: 'Funniest show I've seen this year!' (Audience Review). Julian Stern (Maxim, McSweeney's, FuseTV, Playstation) brings back his beloved 2023 show, Julian Stern Keeps Trying, a show about whether to try. Jokes and songs about OCD, Anne Hathaway at Target, depression-eating an entire rotisserie chicken and the dangers of improv comedy. 2023 Audience reviews: 'Julian’s storytelling is great and his songs are some of the absolute funniest I’ve ever heard'; 'Extremely special!'; 'Outstanding storytelling!'; '(Hopefully not for long) underrated show! A gem of a show!'; Category: Comedy

title: 2lian Stern Keeps 2rying
description: 'Funniest show I've seen this year!' (Audience Review). Julian Stern (Maxim, McSweeney's, FuseTV, Playstation) brings back his beloved 2023 show, Julian Stern Keeps Trying, a show about whether to try. Jokes and songs about OCD, Anne Hathaway at Target, depression-eating an entire rotisserie chicken and the dangers of improv comedy. 2023 Audience reviews: 'Julian’s storytelling is great and his songs are some of the absolute funniest I’ve ever heard'; 'Extremely special!'; 'Outstanding storytelling!'; '(Hopefully not for long) underrated show! A gem of a show!'; Category: Comedy

presenter: Mick Perrin Worldwide by arrangement with The Free Association
description: Three improvisers. Endless possibilities. A unique three-act theatrical comedy experience, created in the moment by an all-star cast of improvisers (Austentatious, St Doctor's Hospital, KoolStoryBro) and very special guests. Three of the UK's finest, funniest improvisers will create a unique and hilarious hour-long play improvised entirely in the moment. In this miraculous feat of spontaneous storytelling, the three performers will play every character – inspired by three audience suggestions, a live musician and three pieces of set – to create a one-of-a-kind show. Brought to you by The Free Association. 'The FA know how to find the funny' (Guardian).; Category: Comedy

title: 3 Chickens Confront Existence
description: Three factory farm chickens attempt to find a greater sense of purpose by engaging each other in a series of philosophical debates, games, feuds and emotional experiments while awaiting their imminent trip to the broiler.; Category: Theatre

title: 3 Couples, 2 Breakups, 1 Barbie and The Berlin Wall
presenter: Square Pegs – Macready Theatre Young Actors’ Company
location: C ARTS | C venues | C aquila
description: Seven teenagers (and a Barbie doll) invite you to a joyfully absurd play about love – in all its weird and wonderful forms. Square Pegs ask lots of questions about what it means to be human in their life-imitating-art play about growing up and in its own inimitable, absurdist fashion, offer absolutely no answers whatsoever! Offie-nominated Macready Theatre Young Actors share tales of breakups, heartache and what it’s like to fall in love with the Berlin Wall with fast-paced, fun-filled story-telling. ‘A short spectacular showcase’ ***** (MumbleTheatre.net). ‘Joyous’ **** (BroadwayBaby.com).; Category: Theatre

title: 3 Kidneys, No Colon
description: Dave infuses humor into the highs and lows of his health journey battling chronic kidney disease and ulcerative colitis, while discovering the resilience of the human spirit.; Category: Comedy

title: 3 Out of 4 Twats
description: Curated, produced and hosted by Glasgow Comic, Jimi Longmuir, this show has evolved across Edinburgh Fringe and GICF since 2022 with acts chosen to best represent the current climate within the world of stand-up. Its one constant is a vibrant and exciting dynamic to delight audiences with a unique atmosphere and vibe. This August, we are bringing NYC internet sensation Ashley Gutermuth, Zimbabwe-born but Orkney-bred comic Grant Gunn and English expat dominatrix Sally Porter with tales of life as a dominatrix in the Netherlands and Falkirk; plus a variety of special guests.; Category: Comedy

title: 3 Queens of New York
presenter: Meka Mo, Onika McLean, Glorelys Mora / Free Festival
description: Three Queens from New York. This hilarious comedic showcase highlights three very different comedians from three very different parts of New York City. These three women all bring a different style and energy to their comedy, but at the end of the day, it’s all very New York!; Category: Comedy

title: 3's Comedy: Afternoons
description: You've had a big lunch, now have a big laugh at 3's Comedy: Afternoons. Featuring Adam Knox, Ben Searle and Jordan Barr, three of the best of the new wave of Australian comedians at the festival. They've done stand-up on television, they've won awards, they've been all over the radio, they've hosted countless podcasts, they've sold out shows, they've gigged around the world and now they've arrived in Edinburgh to do comedy for you!; Category: Comedy

title: 3's Comedy: Late Late Nights
description: It's not late. It's late-late. And there's no better time for some loose laughs than when it's late-late. 3's Comedy: Late Late Nights brings together three of the hottest grots of the new wave of Australian comedy in Lewis Garnham, Alessio Carducci and Ty Gray to make you laugh.; Category: Comedy

title: 3's Comedy: Late Nights
description: The night is young and 3's Comedy: Late Nights is going to bring you an electrifying mix of crowd work and stand-up comedy. You never know what's going to happen at Late Nights, the only guarantee is that you're going to laugh. 3's Comedy: Late Nights stars Ben Searle, Lewis Garnham and Adam Knox, three of the brightest stars of the new wave of Australian comedy. They're staying up late to deliver you some late-night laughs.; Category: Comedy

title: 3's Comedy: Mornings
description: Start your day off with a laugh at 3's Comedy: Mornings. 3's Comedy brings together Adam Knox, Bronwyn Kuss and Peter Jones, three of the rising stars of the new wave of Australian comedy for a whole new hour of hilarious stand-up. They've been seen on TV, they've been heard on the radio and they've been bumped into on public transport on the way to gigs all across the world. Knox, Kuss and Jones are guaranteed to make you laugh. are guaranteed to make you laugh. 'You'll laugh 'til it hurts' (TheWest.com.au).; Category: Comedy

title: 3's Comedy: Nights
description: The sun has gone down and the lights have come up so that means it's time for comedy. 3's Comedy: Nights brings together three of the best young acts of the new wave of Australian comedy for an hour that's jam packed with laughter. Ben Searle, Aidan Jones and Adam Knox have done it all have done it all – they've been on TV, they've been on radio, they've performed all over the world and now they're at the Fringe ready to make you laugh.; Category: Comedy

title: 300 Hours Behind Fringe
presenter: Moni Zhang Comedy and 1 Cent Comedy
description: Ever wondered what it's like to be a Edinburgh Fringe comedian? Neither has Moni Zhang, but she's doing it anyway. Tune in and watch her slowly lose her mind as she live streams her 12-hour workdays for 25 straight days at the Edinburgh Fringe. Because who needs rest when you can have comedy-induced delirium?; Category: Comedy

title: 300 Paintings
description: Winner of eight Australian Fringe Festival awards. Is art a joke? Sydney artist and comedian Sam Kissajukian examines 300 paintings created during a five-month long manic bipolar episode. An epic story exploring art, mental health and creativity.; Category: Theatre

title: The 30th Anniversary Edinburgh London Literary Pub Crawl
presenter: Nick Hennegan – The London Literary Pub Crawl
description: After many acclaimed Edinburgh productions from the Maverick Theatre Company, its writer and director, Nick Hennegan, celebrates his 30 years of the Fringe with this new, unique Edinburgh version of the acclaimed London Literary Pub Crawl! Joining Hennegan will be Charles Dickens, William Shakespeare, Harry Potter, D.I. Rebus and other literary giants who lived and loved in Scotland's capital and frequented many of its fine pubs. It will feature some readings of both modern and contemporary works... and visit many pubs! Alcohol is optional! A literary love letter to Edinburgh from Nick.; Category: Theatre

title: 33 Years Single
description: One-of-a-kind interactive comedy show featuring Australia's most eligible bachelor Daniel Delby who had his first girlfriend at 33... for six weeks. Daniel tells stories of rejection, love and everything in between. But the fun doesn't stop there – you'll have the opportunity to join in with Delby's trademark, his improv freestyle songs, ranging from R&B love songs to red flags being a good thing! 'Delby is a must-see for your Fringe experience. He will have you leaving the show with a grin, wanting to see his next show too.'  ***** (FringeFeed.com.au, 2024).; Category: Comedy

title: 360 ALLSTARS
description: Sold out on Broadway! Sold out at the Sydney Opera House! Seen by over one million people worldwide! BMX, basketball, breakdancing, beatboxing, acrobatics, drumming and more, 360 ALLSTARS connects the street with the elite to deliver a supercharged urban circus. Boasting a stellar cast of World Champion and World Record-holding artists and athletes, the international smash hit returns to Edinburgh as part of its 2024 World Tour! 'Blindingly talented' ***** (BroadwayBaby.com). 'Destined to be a sell-out' ***** (TheWeeReview.com). 'The most thrilling stage show ever' ***** (WeekendNotes.com).; Category: Dance, Physical Theatre and Circus

title: 360° Street Art Exhibition, Spray Paint Tasters and Affordable Art Sale
description: Outdoor 360° wrap-around street art exhibition at Quality Yard in Leith. Bringing creative street art and graffiti by nationally and internationally exhibited artists to Edinburgh.  Newly painted artworks covering over 50m are free to view on six external walls. We accept Pay-What-You-Want donations, have fun Pay-What-You-Want spray paint tasters and an affordable street art prints sale. A unique Edinburgh 360° visual experience in our quiet 18th-century walled courtyard in the heart of Leith’s historic old town. A hidden Leith gem, just 180 metres from The Shore Tram stop.; Category: Exhibitions

title: 3HAMS
location: Just the Tonic at The Mash House
description: 3HAMS is produced by Charlie Traisman and Makena Miller. The play premiered in NYC at Triskelion Arts Brooklyn, and ran at Brooklyn Comedy Collective and Caveat NYC. Director: Billie Aken-Tyers, associate director of the hit show, Titanique (Off-Broadway, Daryl Roth Theater). 3HAMS follows Max and Ry, two friends whose bond was forged through their shared struggle with eating disorders. In the confines of their collective brain, they must confront truths of their unhealthy dynamic, and what is needed to break the cycle. In the muck of it all, the greatest insight comes from an unlikely source… a literal ham.; Category: Theatre

title: 4 Antipodeans Walk into a Bar
location: Scottish Comedy Festival @ The Beehive Inn
description: New Zealand Comedy Award Winner Sully O’Sullivan hosts a rolling showcase of some of the best comedic talent Australasia has to offer. With typical downunder directness, this show does exactly what it says on the tin: one microphone, one stage, and four stand-ups from the other side of the globe. 'Kiwi Sully O'Sullivan is our hilarious host' (ThreeWeeks). 'His timing and wit were impeccable!' (Australian Times). Please note the producers of 4 Antipodeans Walk into a Bar are not liable for any Home Office raids that may occur during the show.; Category: Comedy

title: 4 Comedy Masterminds: Stand up Comedy and Game Show – A Crowd Work Special
description: A Hit Stand-up Comedy Game Show from Berlin makes its debut in Fringe. Get ready for a show that buzzes with laughter and good vibes, thanks to pro-comedians and a unique interactive comedy game that will make your day. Our show promises not just giggles but a wholesome experience of joy, health and beauty, thanks to the magic of laughter! Enjoy a line-up of Edinburgh's finest comedians, carefully curated for this show and with at least five years of stage experience. It's a total blast!; Category: Comedy

title: 4 Funny Feckers
description: Return of the craic! 4 Funny Feckers, a sell-out Fringe favourite, is hosted by cheeky Irish comic Wes Dalton, an Irish charmer who has cheekiness and likeability down to a tee. One of London's most popular stand-up comedy nights, we showcase four fantastic comedians daily from Ireland and beyond. Devour the best of the fest for lunch. At the 2017 Fringe, Wes managed to convince a Dutchman to propose to his girlfriend on stage. The video went viral and the following year they returned to 4 Funny Feckers on their honeymoon. Different acts daily. Keep coming back!; Category: Comedy

title: 4 girls the first letter e
description: In 2012, two girls stabbed their friend 19 times at Slenderman’s instruction. This play is loosely inspired by these real events. Evie and her friends are obsessed with the video-game world of The King. As reality and gameplay blurs, how far will they go to save themselves from each other? This show explores how we teach young girls to grow up and who we should really be afraid of. Its sold-out London reading was described by audiences as 'truly gripping,' 'a beautiful balance of light and dark,' and 'as strong as (it was) understated.'; Category: Theatre

title: #40sandsingle – The Early Morning Cabaret Comedy Show!
presenter: Performer: Joyce Lao. Company Name: The Ally Artists Group LLC
description: Dr. Kara Kibara is a self-proclaimed and successful online dating expert. She has helped thousands of people find love, but she herself is still single in her 40s. In this interactive cabaret show, Dr. Kara goes back to her past and reflects on what went wrong (or maybe right) that caused her to still be loveless. She shares her insights on dating, relationships and love, and she offers her advice on how to find The One.; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 419 Dirty Words
presenter: Fair Pley / The Stand Comedy Club
description: What makes a word into a slur? How can two inoffensive words put together make an offensive phrase? And why are competitive Scrabble players so upset about being denied the chance to use deeply unpleasant language in polite company? Dr Chris Cummins (The University of Edinburgh) takes a look at word meaning and use on the ragged edge of good taste, while trying not to get drafted for the culture wars.; Category: Spoken Word

title: 44 Sex Acts In One Week
description: A fruity apocalyptic rom-com from the razor-sharp pen of Fringe First winner David Finnigan. Girl meets boy. Girl hates boy. Girl f*cks boy 44 times. The world collapses. Some seriously naughty actors go down on their microphones, mangos and melons in this slippery, subversive take on a classic radio play, a clever and uproarious response to humanity's decision to go harder, faster, FASTER! towards the end of the world. 'Brilliantly horny and unhinged.' **** (Time Out). 'You've probably been waiting all year for something to make you laugh this hard' **** (Sydney Morning Herald).; Category: Theatre

title: 45 Degrees of Perspiration
description: Prepare for a great show full of laughter and enlightenment as comedian Ben Harrington tackles one of the most pressing issues of our time in his latest comedy show, 45 Degrees of Perspiration. Ben Harrington fearlessly delves into the complexities of climate change, offering a fresh perspective on the serious subject matter through the lens of humour. The show promises to deliver a blend of clever observations, witty anecdotes and funny commentary that will leave the audience both amused but also informed, while raising awareness about the global environmental crisis.; Category: Comedy

title: 5 Comedians for the Price of None
presenter: The Comedy Clubhouse (Barcelona) / PBH's Free Fringe
description: You have a 20% chance of enjoying the show! With the backing of Barcelona’s Comedy Clubhouse, Europe’s favourite gang of misfit comedians have put together a high-quality rotating line-up of international talents. They've won awards (Best of Brighton Fringe), they've been on TV shows (TV3, Stand Up Revolution) and they've even opened for the world's best comics (Michelle Wolf, Seann Walsh, Gianmarco Soresi and more). With five different comics every night in Richard Gadd’s (creator of Baby Reindeer) debut and favourite Fringe venue, you never know who will drop in.; Category: Comedy

title: 5 Headliners for £10
location: Just the Tonic at The Caves
description: Five top-level circuit comedians perform their very best material, one after the other. No picking on the audience, no MC in between asking you where you're from – just non-stop laughs from headline-level international comedy circuit professionals who know exactly how to bring the funny! There is no better value-for-money way to spend £10 at the Fringe. Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 5 Headliners for £10
description: Five top-level circuit comedians perform their very best material, one after the other. No picking on the audience, no MC in between asking you where you're from – just non-stop laughs from headline-level international comedy circuit professionals who know exactly how to bring the funny! There is no better value-for-money way to spend £10 at the Fringe. Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 5 Headliners for £10
description: Five top-level circuit comedians perform their very best material, one after the other. No picking on the audience, no MC in between asking you where you're from – just non-stop laughs from headline-level international comedy circuit professionals who know exactly how to bring the funny! There is no better value-for-money way to spend £10 at the Fringe. Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 5 Headliners for £10
description: Five top-level circuit comedians perform their very best material, one after the other. No picking on the audience, no MC in between asking you where you're from – just non-stop laughs from headline-level international comedy circuit professionals who know exactly how to bring the funny! There is no better value-for-money way to spend £10 at the Fringe. Total sell-out 2023, so book early!; Category: Comedy

title: 5 Mistakes That Changed History
description: We all make mistakes, but rarely do they change the course of history. Fresh from sold-out runs at Edinburgh, Sydney and Adelaide Fringe Festivals, the smash-hit historical storytelling show returns with a new show and new stories about five people and how their mistakes changed the world. Historian and comedian Paul Coulter brings history to life in a hilarious way. If you hated history at school, this is the show for you. If you loved history at school, stop looking and just book the show. Class credit not provided.; Category: Comedy

title: 5 Nights in Harperspace
description: Acclaimed guitarist/singer/songwriter and double Herald Angel Award winner returns to Edinburgh's Jazz Bar and plays from his extensive back catalogue over five nights. Expect everything from the emotional to the political, from witty to virtuosic, and the singular to the universal... 'One of the finest guitarists, soaring vocals, epic songs' (Mojo). 'Harper has so much musicianship in him, that it just leaks out all over the place' (Times). 'Be there or be denied a life-affirming experience' (Rob Adams, Glasgow Herald). 'Betjeman with a guitar' (Guitarist). 'Acoustic Hendrix!' (Guitar).; Category: Music

title: 50/50 – George Zacharopoulos
description: Jokes from an award-winning comedian who headlines all over the world, followed by jokes based on audience suggestions. 50% stand-up, 50% improv. 50% me, 50% you. Tour support for Jim Jefferies, Larry Dean and Chris McCausland. 'Wicked sense of humour' ***** (TheReviewsHub.com).; Category: Comedy

title: 50/50 – George Zacharopoulos
description: Jokes from an award-winning comedian who headlines all over the world, followed by jokes based on audience suggestions. 50% stand-up, 50% improv. 50% me, 50% you. Tour support for Jim Jefferies, Larry Dean and Chris McCausland. 'Wicked sense of humour' ***** (TheReviewsHub.com).; Category: Comedy

title: 50 Shades of Bouncer
description: A long time has passed since I first stepped on the door. But one thing I still remember like it was yesterday – cold was the night when it all started. During the days that followed that night, I became many things... I graduated four colleges in three different countries earning degrees in law, politics and pedagogy. I worked manual labour, trained in a public sector, was an in-house lawyer, became a teacher and somehow even a college professor. I even ran for parliament! For I am the legion of 50 Shades of Bouncer.; Category: Comedy

title: 50 Ways Jesus (Almost) Ruined My Life
description: Can too much religion in your teens screw up your sex life in your 50s? Then how come Mormons have so many babies? Is eternal life really worth the hassle? Forever is a long time. Especially if you’re married. Why walk on water when you could just take the ferry? Following 2023’s sold-out show, Sharon VS is back with a hilarious double-bill about mid-life crises, losing your religion and finding yourself. This show is for everyone who’s ever questioned their life choices and found a better answer than 'what would Jesus do?'.; Category: Comedy

title: 500 Comedy Fans Can’t Be Wrong
presenter: Chris Scott, Sam Tennent, Natalie Bryce
description: A showcase of up-and-coming Scottish stand-up featuring Chris Scott (Best Newcomer nominee, Scottish Comedy Awards). His ‘why not?’ attitude has seen Chris perform in an underwear advert, at an S&M club and, less strangely, support Fringe favourites Alex Edelman and Susie McCabe. Chris is either joined by Sam Tennent (starting comedy after a life-threatening illness, he’s sold out multiple shows at the Glasgow Comedy Festival and somehow, once supported rapper Coolio); or Natalie Bryce (Scottish Comedian of the Year Finalist). Natalie is caring at heart but clumsy by nature, 'her gregarious personality engages' (Chortle.co.uk).; Category: Comedy

title: 6 Impossible Things
description: An Alice in Wonderland parody magic show! Come be part of the magic! Las Vegas magician Jordan Rooks combines magic, comedy and storytelling into an unforgettable time! Jordan's unique parody and magic shows combine stories we all grew up to love, real-world situations and brings magic to a whole new level. You won't want to miss this!; Category: Comedy

title: 6 Steps To Success From The "Award Winning" Dave Chawner
description: Last year Dave won an award who's title felt like a back-handed compliment. That led to a crisis of confidence and an exploration of what success really looks like. As seen on BBC, ITV and Channel 4. As heard on Radio 1, Radio 2 and Radio 4.; Category: Comedy

title: 60 Minutes About Scotland
description: With Vladimir McTavish and friends. Three-time winner at the Scottish Comedy Awards and 'one of the finest acts on the Scottish comedy circuit' (Guardian) hosts a one-hour showcase featuring some of the top names in stand-up from north of the border. Guests change daily, but an hour of hilarious world-class stand-up from Scotland is guaranteed. Total sell-out at the 2022 and 2023 Fringe. 'Inspired comedy brilliance' (AustralianStage.com.au).; Category: Comedy

title: 60 Minutes Comedy Tour of the World: The Local Immigrant
description: Prateek is a man of the world but don't call him an immigrant! Call him a New Yorker, Berliner, Spaniard or a Delhi Boy. His new special will take you on a world comedy tour, all through the eyes of an immigrant trying to integrate in different cultures as a local. Let's talk about Berlin's fetish scene and dating life where being monogamous is a red flag, Indian arranged marriages, and breathing in New York – expensive!; Category: Comedy

title: 60 Minutes or Less: Or Your Comedy Free!
description: Hootenannies Fringe Act of the Year Winner and Runner up join forces again this year to bring you another stellar comedy show! In this novel concept the two stand-ups endeavour to perform for no more than 30 minutes each! Who could listen to a performance for any longer? Not me. Unless it was really really good. This show is really good, a good amount for the price range. The title is inspired by the movie 30 Minutes or Less where you can see a lady's boobs in one scene, which is nice.; Category: Comedy

title: 69 and Under Date Night Comedy
description: A comedy show that is perfect for date night with friends or partners. Award-winning comedian and host of Sunday Singles, Daniel Delby is your MC for the night. We start with some freestyle love songs, then decide what red/green flags are OK, an old-school perfect-match game for couples, as well as reading out the audience's own horror date stories and "icks" they've written and dropped into the story box prior to the show. 'So bloody funny, awesome interactive acts and the most hilarious freestyle too. Seriously recommend.' (FringeFeed.com.au 2024).; Category: Comedy

title: 74th Annual Sunger Games
description: District 12, Katniss Everdeen, Ryanair. Worlds collide in this daring crossover. Music, so often a beacon of revolutionary expression, brings the popular Hunger Games universe to life as over 25 performers take to the stage in an all-singing, all-dancing a cappella adventure through the dangerous Capitol of Panem. What twist and turns lay waiting for our humble British tourists? Come and find out... and may the odds be ever in your flavour. That's the slogan right? Right.; Category: Music

title: 800 Pound Gorilla Alumni Showcase
description: US/UK Comedy Label 800 Pound Gorilla proudly presents this silly showcase celebrating some of its finest alumni.
