With recent releases from Fringe-favourites including Ivo Graham, Helen Bauer, Christopher Macarthur-Boyd, Josh Glanc, Harriet Kemsley, Josh Pugh, Dan Rath and Stuart Laws (to name a few); expect a stellar line-up and banana-flavoured cocktails (if they work out a palatable recipe by then).; Category: Comedy

title: 99 Red Hot Kitties and a Cockatoo
presenter: Red Hot Kitty Burlesque and Cabaret
description: Cheeky and spirited, 99 Red Hot Kitties and a Cockatoo possesses an endearing seductiveness, with time-honoured burlesque and fan dances. Features a mix of seasoned performers and local, new, up-and-coming performers loving the skin they are in. This show is highly energetic and will leave audiences spellbound.; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: 999 Problems
location: Just the Tonic at The Mash House
description: Multi award-winning Irish comedian Paul Marsh is back with his new show about turning 50, marriage and firefighting. Join Paul and his friend Lorcan on guitar, for a gag-filled hour of stories, songs, audience participation and one-liners (loads of one-liners!). The two biggest comedy clubs in Dublin refer to him as 'Ireland's biggest gag merchant' and 'the king of one-liners'. You are guaranteed a fast-paced hour of laughter, with more jokes and variety than any other show at this year's Fringe!; Category: Comedy

title: The A Cappella Xperience
description: The Bristol Suspensions take you on a journey through their 10th year as a group – their triumphs, their pressures and everything in between. This student group from the University of Bristol have just hit their 10th year and want you to celebrate with them in this concert-style show. The Suspensions deliver stunning vocals, slick choreography, beautiful arrangements and leave you wondering why you didn't join an a cappella group at university. The group will give you a glimpse into the world of a cappella and leave you wanting more!; Category: Music

title: A.L.Ex and The ImpRobots Present: An AI Show for Kids!
description: Sixty minutes of hilarious fast-paced interactive science theatre for the whole family featuring real robots, AI, and laughs. Join A.L.Ex. the fully autonomous improvising-comedy robot and The Improbots, a trio of comedian scientists as they explore the science of humour. Mixing slapstick and improv comedy with provocative questions about human and artificial intelligence, kids big and small will have an opportunity to interact with A.L.Ex through improv games, dance, and silly challenges while exploring funny science.; Category: Children's Shows

title: A-Z: The Geek's Guide to Seduction
description:
From Android to Zuckerberg – how to woo a partner whilst talking about discount codes, skincare routines and Wrestlemania. Darius Davies presents A-Z: The Geek's Guide to Seduction. Expect a 'a rock-solid hour of constant laughs... supercharged by precision timing and an impassioned, charismatic delivery' (Chortle.co.uk). 'Hilarious... Brutally funny' (Scotsman). 'Energetic, self-aware and genuinely hilarious... a must watch' (The Student).

; Category: Comedy

title: AAA Batteries (Not Included)
location: Just the Tonic at The Caves
description: An hour of sharp gags, quick wit and high energy hijinks from three of the comedy circuit's funniest performers. Don't miss out on one of the Fringe's most popular all-ages comedy shows, returning for its twelfth year at the Edinburgh Fringe after hundreds of sell-out shows! 'Humour for everyone... I can't recommend it highly enough' ***** (ThreeWeeks). 'This show has to have wide appeal. Thankfully, it has bucket loads... a great show' **** (Skinny). 'Obtains every ounce of mirth... keeping adults, children and teens alike rejoicing' **** (EdFestMag.com).; Category: Comedy

title: Aaaaa Very Fringey Show
description: What makes the perfect Fringe show: comedy, theatre, magic, puppets, improv? Yes. The perfect show is every show in one. Spend 50 minutes with four young hopefuls who will pitch to you the fringiest Fringe show ever! You’re the hotshot new producer with a venue to fill and these four think they have a show that will pack in the crowds… and if their first pitch doesn’t wow you, they’ve got another hundred ideas for the ultimate Fringe hour! They won’t take no for an answer and in the end their…"immeasurable" talent will win you over!!; Category: Comedy

title: Aaaaaaaaaaaargh! Here Comes Trouble!
description: Masai Graham, does his first-ever solo show, with tales about how he got into comedy, the clean jokes that won him multiple awards and (more importantly) the naughty jokes that got him into multiple trouble.; Category: Comedy

title: Aaaaaaaaaaargh! It's 101 Clean Jokes in 30 Minutes
description: Award-winning gag merchant and three-time Joke of the Fringe winner Masai Graham delivers over 100 clean jokes in half an hour. Expect punchy puns, outstanding one-liners and wizardry wordplay in this 3.3 laughs-per-minute bonanza. 'Annoyingly good' (Gary Delaney).; Category: Comedy

title: Aaaaaaaaaaargh! It's 101 Naughty Jokes in 30 Minutes
description: Award-winning gag-merchant and three-time Joke of the Fringe winner Masai Graham delivers over 100 naughty jokes in half an hour. Expect punchy puns, outstanding one-liners and wizardry wordplay in this 3.3 laughs-per-minute bonanza. 'Annoyingly good' (Gary Delaney).; Category: Comedy

title: Aaaaaaaaaaargh! It's the One Liner Show
description: Enjoy an hour of the best up-and-coming one-liner comedians on the circuit in this celebration of puns, one-liners and wordplay. Hosted by UK Pun Champion and Joke of the Fringe winner 2016, 2021 and 2022 Masai Graham. ; Category: Comedy

title: Aaaah Look Who It Is: Jed Potts and Nicole Smit, Again!
presenter: Jed Potts and Nicole Cassandra Smit
description: The King and Queen of Scottish blues are back with their tongue-in-cheek take on jazz, country and dreamy soundscapes. Jed and Nicole's banter will make you laugh and the songs will bring some tears, guaranteed. For fans of Patsy Cline, George Jones, Nina Simone and Patti Page.; Category: Music

title: Aaaand Now for Something Completely Improvised
description: Improv legends Racing Minds return to Edinburgh for their 11th year of unscripted escapades! A doddery grandfather can't quite remember his ripping yarn, but with your help, a mystery stuffed with hilarious characters, whip-smart wit and breathtaking twists will take hasty shape before your very eyes. Anything could happen, but excitement is guaranteed in this improvised comic adventure based entirely on audience suggestions! 'Clever, funny and satisfying' (SundayTimes). 'Crafted by the gods of comedy' ***** (ThreeWeeks). 'Insanely original' ***** (TheNewCurrent.co.uk). 'Improv at its very best' (BroadwayBaby.com). Suitable for all ages.; Category: Comedy

title: Aaalternative Comedy Club
description: Teknicolour Smoof's alternative comedy club comes to the Edinburgh Fringe with five different comedians each day. Expect the weird and the bonkers but always something for everyone.; Category: Comedy

title: Aalex Mandel-Dallal: As She Lives and Breathes
description: Here she is! Join Aalex, one of London’s most exciting comics, for tales of her pigeon enemies, self-mastering her shortcomings and giving advice nobody should take. Watch her ask, 'to kid, or not to kid, is that the question?' as she experienced the crazy scientific thing women in these times can do now: egg freezing. The very honest whys, hows and now whats? With dramatic tales of what went wrong thrown in. Be prepared to cross your legs and attempt to protect your ovaries, whether you have them or not.; Category: Comedy

title: Aardvark Comedy with Dylan Clarke
description: Aardvark Comedy returns to the Edinburgh Fringe following a successful run in 2023. This mixed-bill comedy show contains some of the best new comedians on the scene and little to no aardvark-related content, but the show's creator insisted we aimed for the number one spot in the Fringe's alphabetically ordered programme. Unfortunately, the same creator failed to notice that numbers are prioritized over letters in the programme, an oversight which has caused the show to fall to the fourth page of the comedy listings, just sneaking in before a couple of Aarons.; Category: Comedy

title: Aardvark Comedy with Dylan Clarke
description: Aardvark Comedy returns to the Edinburgh Fringe following a successful run in 2023. This mixed-bill comedy show contains some of the best new comedians on the scene and little to no aardvark-related content, but the show's creator insisted we aimed for the number one spot in the Fringe's alphabetically ordered programme. Unfortunately, the same creator failed to notice that numbers are prioritized over letters in the programme, an oversight which has caused the show to fall to the fourth page of the comedy listings, just sneaking in before a couple of Aarons.; Category: Comedy

title: Aaron Chen: Funny Garden
description: 'Life is bristling with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to cultivate one's garden' (Voltaire). 'You're allowed to put whatever you like in your blurb. It doesn't even have to describe the show' (Aaron). Born and raised in Sydney, Aaron's quickly climbed the ranks of the international comedy scene. Aaron made his mark on Australian comedy with his debut solo show in 2017 and has since toured to sold-out crowds and rave reviews, earning him the sought-after awards for Best Newcomer and Director's Choice and nomination for Best Show at Melbourne International Comedy Festival.; Category: Comedy

title: Aaron Hartnell-Booth Plays Mozart With the Glendal Quintet
description: Enjoy an evening of Clarinet Quintet music performed by the Glendal Quintet, a talented group of graduates of the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. Aaron Hartnell-Booth, master of the clarinet and bass clarinet will play the wonderful quintet by Mozart, York Bowen's Phantasy Quintet (for bass clarinet) and premiere Nigel Don's Clarinet Quintet. He will be accompanied by Sophie Hamilton and Yik Liang Soo (violins), Aaron Morrison (viola) and Rebekah Lesan (cello).; Category: Music

title: Aaron Levene: An ADHD Love Story (WIP)
description: Does everyone have ADHD? What's it like being married to a space cadet? Lots of asides are a sign of ADHD! 'Acidic wit' **** (Edinburgh Reporter). 'Didn't put a foot wrong. Adept, funny, very good' (NottsComedyReview.wordpress.com).; Category: Comedy

title: Aaron Twitchen: Himbo
description: Dumped during his best friend's wedding, Aaron has decided to laugh it off. 'Hilarious, warm, energetic... Twitchen is a quadruple threat' (Skinny). After making poor choices himself, Aaron hands you control to choose the comedy topics you want. Expect jokes about dating disasters, pop-culture and geriatric millennials in this camp, energetic hour. 'Fierce, fresh and fabulous' (Alesha Dixon). From star of Channel 4's Dumped and host Top 20 Apple charting podcast Pod of the Pops. A show for anyone who has loved, lost or longed for a diamond the size of their fist.; Category: Comedy

title: Aaron Wood: Chameleon
description: When you were younger you'd look at adults and think they had it all figured out. Now we're adults we realise none of us have a clue what we're doing. Wandering around pretending, trying to blend in and hoping nobody notices. Following a sold-out run in 2023, Aaron Wood is back and finally has it all figured out. Honest(!). Described as talent way beyond his time on the circuit and host of the Off Ya Chest podcast with over 100 million views online. 'A very big future in this business!' (Tom Stade). 'Absolutely brilliant' (Tim Vine).; Category: Comedy

title: ABBA Gold The Concert
description: Calling all Dancing Queens! Featuring an all-star cast of the UK's finest musicians and vocalists, ABBA Gold The Concert is packed with all of ABBA's greatest hits, stunningly authentic costumes, superb choreographed dance routines and a sprinkling of light-hearted humour which make this a show which is not to be missed. So dust down your platforms, put on your flares and sing along with all of your favourite ABBA hits including: Waterloo, Mamma Mia, Thank You For The Music, Take A Chance On Me, Dancing Queen, Winner Takes It All, Gimme, Gimme, Gimme... and many more!; Category: Music

title: ABBA Odyssey – The Live Concert!
location: Greyfriars Hall at Virgin Hotels Edinburgh
description: Come and see ABBA Odyssey – The Live Concert! This all-seated show features singers who produce the most authentic tribute to the iconic ABBA sound. With over 12 years of experience performing throughout the UK together, our Agnetha and Frida (Fran and Kat) have perfected their highly acclaimed vocal blend. ABBA Odyssey – The Live Concert! features all the hits that you know and love, plus a few hidden gems for the most devoted ABBA fans! Suitable for all ages.; Category: Music

title: Abbi Cole and Ancika Mester: Shinpads
presenter: Abbi Cole and Ancika Mester / PBH's Free Fringe
description: A split-bill stand-up hour from Abbi Cole (Hastings Newcomer of the Year finalist) and Ancika Mester (as heard on BBC Radio London). Ancika is sweaty, loosey-goosey and Australian. Abbi is a bit uptight, but still fun. Together they will give you a generous portion of the surreal and wacky. Both are Soho Theatre Comedy Labs Plus alumni, and part of Gigl Comedy/ 'Courageous, funny and refreshing' ***** (MumbleComedy.net).; Category: Comedy

title: Abby Wambaugh: The First 3 Minutes of 17 Shows
description: Abby awoke in hospital after a late miscarriage and, high on anaesthesia, decided to become a comedian. In this silly, goofy, heartfelt show Abby presents her best 17 ideas for her highly anticipated debut hour, including potential hits like Old Man Learns Parkour and a very long impression of the number nine. Funny Women finalist and co-host of Help Hole podcast alongside Sofie Hagen. 'Reminiscent of Hannah Gadsby or Tig Notaro... Tackles what could be a thorny, complex subject with grace, underplayed charm and some great jokes' (Chortle.co.uk).; Category: Comedy

title: ABC of One-Liner Jokes
description: An hilarious one-hour alphabetical journey in the medium of quick fire One-Liner Jokes. The material is both insightful, clever and funny from one of the best emerging one-liner comics in the North of England.; Category: Comedy

title: Abi Clarke: (Role) Model
description: Abi Clarke lived the modern-day dream. She posted a video online, went to bed a "nobody", then woke to thousands of followers. Four years later, this is the debut show they've been waiting for, though it may not be exactly what they want from her... As seen on BBC, ITV2, Comedy Central, Channel 4 and support to Phil Wang and Russell Kane. With 2M followers across platforms, she's taken the internet by storm, but now it's time to see what she does best, stand-up! 'Fresh, silly and very very funny' (Sara Pascoe). 'Hilarious and relatable' (Independent).; Category: Comedy

title: Abigail Rolling: Shit Lawyer
description: Dark. Funny. Underfunded. And that's just Abby. The criminal justice system is too. With three decades on the front line, Abby shares hilarious real cases from her own experience as a practising defence solicitor, speaking to all that's wrong with a justice system in existential crisis. From the Post Office scandal to a one-woman shoplifting epidemic, Abby's new show warns that any one of us could get caught up in it at any time. But with the justice system in a death spiral, will there be any legal-aid defence lawyers left to help you?; Category: Comedy

title: About Comedy: Stand-Up Comedy Course
description: Learn the skills and art of performing stand-up comedy on this two-day intensive comedy course. Including: joke-writing skills, generating material, comedy deconstruction, finding material, lively interactive performance practice sessions, history of comedy, technical skills, industry tips. Plus, a graduation show performance in a Fringe show. Our tutors are professional comedians, comedy writers and experienced teachers. The courses run over two days, with two four-and-a-half hour sessions on each day, followed by the graduation show. 'This course has to be one of the best on offer. Highly recommended' **** (ThreeWeeks). Further course information available at: http://www.laughinghorsecomedy.co.uk/comedy/courses2day.asp ; Category: Comedy

title: Abracadabra Family Friendly Magic Show
description: Join Alex the Magician for an exciting children's magic show, back for its fourth year at the Edinburgh Fringe. Laughter, participation, fun, and of course, magic await! Witness the 'fantastic humour, charming presence and unique magic' (WorldMagicReview.com).; Category: Children's Shows

title: Abrasion
description: A one-woman show (written and starring Meg-Rose Dixon) following a diagnosis journey set at the anniversary of her surgery. A dark comedy filled with turbulent embarrassing moments flipped in a comical way, verbatim anecdotes highlighting the importance of patient care, terrible doctors, and a few genuine heroes. This is a darkly funny show that laughs in the face of pain while shedding light on a condition that affects 1.5 million people, but has an average diagnosis wait time of 7.5 years.; Category: Theatre

title: Abs Flab
description: Abs Flab: Outrageous, raunchy and inappropriate. You're gonna pee in your pants laughing – come for the show, leave feeling uplifted and relieved. Gill's not your mum. Scottish comic Gill Cordiner returns to Edinburgh to rip up the stage which her high-octane wild comedy. Be warned – you will laugh till your face hurts! Relatable and ridiculous, Abs Flab is the show for everyone who hates the gym but loves cheese.; Category: Comedy

title: Absolute Chaos
description: The cult show returns! Think you can take down a comedian? Then come to Absolute Chaos – a comedy heckle show, where you the audience are given free reign to heckle comedians – just be prepared to get heckled right back. Not for the faint of heart: get plenty of liquid courage in you and do your worst! Top Shows of Edinburgh Fringe 2023 (Euronews.com).; Category: Comedy

title: Absolute Improv!
description: For over 10 years Absolute Improv! has entertained sell-out audiences with off-the-cuff comedy performances from Scotland’s top improvisational comedy actors. For over 10 years audiences have suggested ideas to inspire side-splitting sketches created in the moment: truly you-had-to-be-there comedy created before the audience’s eyes. This Edinburgh Fringe, join us and the finest improv comedy talent in Scotland once more for spontaneously sparkling family-friendly performances that have never been seen before, and are never to be seen again! Official Fringe Sell-Out Show 2013-2017. ‘Absolute magic!’ ***** (Cream of the Fringe).; Category: Comedy

title: Absolute Monopoly
description: Monopoly is a terrible game. It ruins friendships and destroys families. Join comedian Benjamin Alborough as he attempts to improve Monopoly in this chaotic, interactive gameshow where audience members compete against each other and the host, with the audience physically becoming the game board. The show combines role playing, physical challenges and psychological intimidation to make something that, if not the best board game in the world, is at least short. ***** (EdFringeReview.com). ***** (ThreeWeeks). ***** (NorthWestEnd.co.uk) ****½ (One4Review.co.uk). **** (Chortle.co.uk). **** (TheRecs.co.uk). **** (BingeFringe.com).; Category: Comedy

title: Absolute Nickhead (Kirk In Progress)
description: Nick Kirk (West End New Act Finalist 2023) presents his first solo show featuring one man, no hair and a cast of supporting characters unpicking what life is like when you're hitting those awkward middle (age) years. '[The character of safety officer Dave Steed is] an amusing tragi-comic conceit and expertly performed with fine timing' (Chortle.co.uk); 'Stupendous stand-up... Nick Kirk has some fabulous material' (TheatreScotland.co.uk).; Category: Comedy

title: Absolutely (not) Free – An Evening of Zappa
description: A smorgasbord of Frank Zappa classics hand-delivered by those finest purveyors of conceptual continuity, Pygmy Twylyte! Expect pickles, poodles, dental floss, snowballs and stinky feet! Two nights only!; Category: Music

title: Absurd: A Live Cabaret Panel Show
presenter: Ava Beaux and Kane & Abel / PBH’s Free Fringe
description: Fun, joyous, raucous… absurd! Join magicians Ava Beaux, Kane & Abel for a riotous evening of wacky games and cabaret performances. Watch playful performers battle to win, cheer on your favourite and even join in the revelry if you’re feeling absurd enough! Optional participation, different guest acts each night, party hats encouraged and an unnecessarily dramatic forfeit ceremony; it’s absurdity at its best! 'An upbeat romp through a wide variety of acts' **** (NorthWestEnd.com). 'Endlessly watchable performers.' **** (BroadwayBaby.com). 'Top Weekend Comedy Pick' (Times). 'Slick patter, a cleverly-worked persona' **** (List). ***** (WorldMagicReview.com).; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: Aca-ballad of a Uni Student
description: Ever wondered what Pitch perfect would be like at a UK university? Come find out! In a flat full of chunder charts and impromptu musical numbers, follow Steelworks through the trials of uni life. Is anyone actually in room 3? Why does the hoover smell? Did those two sleep together? But… I digress… Established at the University of Sheffield (2017), Steelworks annually perform in the International Championship of Collegiate A Cappella. Following rave reviews of their Fringe debut (2023), Steelworks are back with charisma, stunning vocals, and a brand-new show you won’t want to miss!; Category: Music

title: The Academy Trust: Under New Management!
description: 'Should I hand in my notice?' A question that resonates with every teacher, and Rachel is no exception. As a new trust takes over the school, bringing with it a slew of initiatives, quality assurance measures, and supposedly "workload-friendly" schemes, one thing remains constant: the perennially empty stationary cupboard. Join Rachel and her colleagues as they navigate the absurdities of bureaucracy, juggle newfound responsibilities, and grapple with the everyday chaos of teaching life. The Academy Trust is a comedic rollercoaster, blending sketch-show wit with political satire, all written and performed by teachers.; Category: Theatre

title: Accidental Baby
description: Real-life dating, brimming with possibilities for passion, romance, or smashing a stranger in the back of your Toyota Camry while they moan a name you don't recognise. How does one navigate the whirlwind of dating and relationships in a world with AI and easy sex? Answer: with the help of comedians. Come to an amazing intimate show where you can receive dating advice from some of the funniest people at Fringe. Or, better yet, watch other people spill their tea as live comedians do their very best to help them out. They're not therapists, they're better: they're funny.; Category: Comedy

title: Accidental Pop: Now That's What I Call Safety!
description: Alright, stop, collaborate and listen! Safety expert Ian Crawford is back with a brand-new presentation. This deadly serious workshop delivers essential safety advice inspired by iconic pop hits. With tips to dodge Tragedy, the Danger Zone and ensure you keep Stayin’ Alive. Don't Stop Believin' in avoiding hazards: just take your passion and make it happen. Grab your Ticket to Safety before it is too late. ‘Well-honed, good silly fun’ **** (TheReviewsHub.com) and ‘forking good’ **** (TheWeeReview.com).; Category: Comedy

title: Accidentally on Purpose
description: Want to know who murdered my theatre company? Me. Seduction? Check. Betrayal? Check. No checks? Check. The desire for the femme fatale and inclusive ambitions? All of that. I killed it. And I'm going to tell you how. Members of a fledgling theatre company, Studio 212, set out to devise a theatre piece based on the great film noir, Double Indemnity. Will the inclination to change the world through art cause irreparable damage to the very artists who are making it?; Category: Dance, Physical Theatre and Circus

title: Accommo-dating
description: One birthday. Three housemates. A whole lot of surprises. Mollie, Phoebe and Skye have been inseparable since they met at university. Living together presents all sort of joys and trials, and tonight is no different: it’s Phoebe's birthday, and they’re hosting a dinner. Things are about to be shaken up by something they never expected to have in common, and, with the arrival of their guest, the girls find themselves forced to confront their attitudes towards dating, relationships and each other head-on.; Category: Theatre

title: Accordion Ryan's Pop Bangers
description: Covering artists from across the pop music spectrum, Accordion Ryan will sing and play your favourite songs like you've never heard them before! Add in a few of his own hilarious tunes and this show is guaranteed to bring a smile to your face. Fresh off an appearance on Britain's Got Talent and a hit run at the 2023 Edinburgh Fringe, he's excited to be back this year! Join in and sing along during this night of music, laughter and overall fun! 'You're funny, I like you' (Simon Cowell). 'Just brilliant…go see him!' (Gary: Tank Commander).; Category: Cabaret and Variety

title: The Accused
description: Guilty or not guilty? You decide! From the sell-out production team of the Inner Temple Drama Society comes a story of anger, revenge, love and secrecy. After a superstar is found dead in her dressing room all fingers point to Daniel… but did he kill her? That’s the question on everyone’s lips but only the jury will decide. Join the Inner Temple Drama Society for this interactive show which follows a murder trial. Whilst serious, you can expect a few dance and drag appearances. We promise you will not have seen anything quite like it.; Category: Theatre

title: Achilles, Death of the Gods.
description: A new, bold, poetic reimagining of the myth of Achilles, from storyteller and classicist Jo Kelen. The warrior Achilles finds himself in Troy, fighting a war that is not his. Following a bloody and tragic sequence of events, Achilles’ lover Patroclus is killed in battle. Achilles, enveloped in an insatiable rage and desire for retribution, inflicts unspeakable horrors upon those around him. Content Warnings: Explicit reference to violence, sexual violence and mutilation of the body.; Category: Spoken Word

title: Achtung!! The Germans Are Coming! Second Coming
location: PBH's Free Fringe @ Brewdog Doghouse Hotel
description: Wacky German jokemeister Jürgen's comedy collision is back for a second helping of schnitzel schwitzen! Along with comedy friends and pros! Following a successful Edinburgh Festival Fringe and a sold-out Leicester Comedy Festival, this show is wunder-bar! (Great pub in Düsseldorf, that). 'Very funny, memorable comedian' (The Stand Comedy Club). 'What a hurricane' (Robin Ince). 'A funny guy' (Mike McShane). 'Brilliantly mad' (Mike Gunn). 'Spike Milligan-esque' (Logan Murray).; Category: Comedy
